verses.kjv: And it came to pass in those days, that the Philistines gathered their armies together for warfare, to fight with Israel. And Achish said unto David, Know thou assuredly, that thou shalt go out with me to battle, thou and thy men.
verses.ct: During that time, the Philistines assembled their forces to wage war against Israel. Achish told David, "You need to understand that you and your men will be marching into battle alongside me."

verses.kjv: And David said to Achish, Surely thou shalt know what thy servant can do. And Achish said to David, Therefore will I make thee keeper of mine head for ever.
verses.ct: David replied to Achish, "Then you'll see for yourself what your servant is capable of." Achish responded, "In that case, I'll make you my permanent bodyguard."

verses.kjv: Now Samuel was dead, and all Israel had lamented him, and buried him in Ramah, even in his own city. And Saul had put away those that had familiar spirits, and the wizards, out of the land.
verses.ct: Now Samuel had died, and all of Israel had mourned for him and buried him in Ramah, his hometown. Saul had also expelled all the mediums and spiritists from the land.

verses.kjv: And the Philistines gathered themselves together, and came and pitched in Shunem: and Saul gathered all Israel together, and they pitched in Gilboa.
verses.ct: The Philistines gathered and set up camp at Shunem, while Saul assembled all of Israel and they set up camp at Gilboa.

verses.kjv: And when Saul saw the host of the Philistines, he was afraid, and his heart greatly trembled.
verses.ct: When Saul saw the Philistine army, he was terrified, and his heart was shaking with dread.

verses.kjv: And when Saul enquired of the LORD, the LORD answered him not, neither by dreams, nor by Urim, nor by prophets.
verses.ct: Saul tried to seek guidance from the LORD, but the LORD did not answer him — not through dreams, not through the Urim, and not through prophets.

verses.kjv: Then said Saul unto his servants, Seek me a woman that hath a familiar spirit, that I may go to her, and enquire of her. And his servants said to him, Behold, there is a woman that hath a familiar spirit at Endor.
verses.ct: So Saul told his servants, "Find me a woman who is a medium so I can go consult with her." His servants told him, "There is a woman who is a medium at Endor."

verses.kjv: And Saul disguised himself, and put on other raiment, and he went, and two men with him, and they came to the woman by night: and he said, I pray thee, divine unto me by the familiar spirit, and bring me him up, whom I shall name unto thee.
verses.ct: Saul disguised himself by putting on different clothing, and he went with 2 men to visit the woman at night. He said, "Please consult a spirit for me and bring up the person I name for you."

verses.kjv: And the woman said unto him, Behold, thou knowest what Saul hath done, how he hath cut off those that have familiar spirits, and the wizards, out of the land: wherefore then layest thou a snare for my life, to cause me to die?
verses.ct: The woman said to him, "Look, you know what Saul has done — how he eliminated all the mediums and spiritists from the land. So why are you setting a trap for me to get me killed?"

verses.kjv: And Saul sware to her by the LORD, saying, As the LORD liveth, there shall no punishment happen to thee for this thing.
verses.ct: Saul swore an oath to her by the LORD, saying, "As surely as the LORD lives, you will not be punished for doing this."

verses.kjv: Then said the woman, Whom shall I bring up unto thee? And he said, Bring me up Samuel.
verses.ct: Then the woman asked, "Who should I bring up for you?" He answered, "Bring up Samuel for me."

verses.kjv: And when the woman saw Samuel, she cried with a loud voice: and the woman spake to Saul, saying, Why hast thou deceived me? for thou art Saul.
verses.ct: When the woman saw Samuel, she screamed loudly. Then she said to Saul, "Why did you deceive me? You are Saul!"

verses.kjv: And the king said unto her, Be not afraid: for what sawest thou? And the woman said unto Saul, I saw gods ascending out of the earth.
verses.ct: The king told her, "Don't be afraid. What do you see?" The woman said to Saul, "I see a spirit-like figure rising up from the ground."

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, What form is he of? And she said, An old man cometh up; and he is covered with a mantle. And Saul perceived that it was Samuel, and he stooped with his face to the ground, and bowed himself.
verses.ct: He asked her, "What does he look like?" She said, "An elderly man is coming up, and he's wrapped in a robe." Saul recognized that it was Samuel, and he dropped to the ground with his face down and bowed low.

verses.kjv: And Samuel said to Saul, Why hast thou disquieted me, to bring me up? And Saul answered, I am sore distressed; for the Philistines make war against me, and God is departed from me, and answereth me no more, neither by prophets, nor by dreams: therefore I have called thee, that thou mayest make known unto me what I shall do.
verses.ct: Samuel said to Saul, "Why have you disturbed me by bringing me up?" Saul answered, "I'm in terrible distress. The Philistines are waging war against me, and God has turned away from me and won't answer me anymore — not through prophets or through dreams. So I called on you to tell me what I should do."

verses.kjv: Then said Samuel, Wherefore then dost thou ask of me, seeing the LORD is departed from thee, and is become thine enemy?
verses.ct: Samuel replied, "Why are you asking me, since the LORD has turned away from you and has become your enemy?"

verses.kjv: And the LORD hath done to him, as he spake by me: for the LORD hath rent the kingdom out of thine hand, and given it to thy neighbour, even to David:
verses.ct: The LORD has done exactly what he announced through me. The LORD has torn the kingdom away from you and given it to your neighbor David.

verses.kjv: Because thou obeyedst not the voice of the LORD, nor executedst his fierce wrath upon Amalek, therefore hath the LORD done this thing unto thee this day.
verses.ct: Because you did not obey the LORD's command and did not carry out his fierce judgment against the Amalekites, the LORD has done this to you today.

verses.kjv: Moreover the LORD will also deliver Israel with thee into the hand of the Philistines: and to morrow shalt thou and thy sons be with me: the LORD also shall deliver the host of Israel into the hand of the Philistines.
verses.ct: What's more, the LORD will hand both Israel and you over to the Philistines. Tomorrow, you and your sons will be here with me. The LORD will also hand Israel's army over to the Philistines."

verses.kjv: Then Saul fell straightway all along on the earth, and was sore afraid, because of the words of Samuel: and there was no strength in him; for he had eaten no bread all the day, nor all the night.
verses.ct: Immediately Saul collapsed full length on the ground, completely overcome with terror because of Samuel's words. He had no strength left, since he hadn't eaten anything all day and all night.

verses.kjv: And the woman came unto Saul, and saw that he was sore troubled, and said unto him, Behold, thine handmaid hath obeyed thy voice, and I have put my life in my hand, and have hearkened unto thy words which thou spakest unto me.
verses.ct: The woman came over to Saul and saw how deeply shaken he was. She said to him, "Look, your servant obeyed you. I risked my life and listened to what you asked of me."

verses.kjv: Now therefore, I pray thee, hearken thou also unto the voice of thine handmaid, and let me set a morsel of bread before thee; and eat, that thou mayest have strength, when thou goest on thy way.
verses.ct: "Now please, listen to your servant as well. Let me bring you some food to eat so you'll have the strength to travel on your way."

verses.kjv: But he refused, and said, I will not eat. But his servants, together with the woman, compelled him; and he hearkened unto their voice. So he arose from the earth, and sat upon the bed.
verses.ct: He refused and said, "I won't eat." But his servants, along with the woman, urged him until he agreed. So he got up from the ground and sat on the bed.

verses.kjv: And the woman had a fat calf in the house; and she hasted, and killed it, and took flour, and kneaded it, and did bake unleavened bread thereof:
verses.ct: The woman had a fattened calf at her house. She quickly slaughtered it, then took flour, kneaded it, and baked unleavened bread.

verses.kjv: And she brought it before Saul, and before his servants; and they did eat. Then they rose up, and went away that night.
verses.ct: She served the food to Saul and his servants, and they ate. Then they got up and left that same night.
